chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Joseph Le Botte

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew J. Lebotte in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that cases are not resolved, Defendant believes there's more investigation that needs to be done. Discussion regarding which case to put on trial docket. Case will track 14-CF-156.

Defendant Matthew J. Lebotte appeared by phone. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared in Court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant called to say his mother, who is also his ride, has medical issues that prevent her from driving. Cases are not resolved, but Defense thinks they will. Court questions Defendant, who wants to talk to his lawyer more. If not resolved at that time, case will be set for trial.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Status conference set for August 20, 2015 at 3:00.

Defendant Matthew Joseph Le Botte in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Matthew Joseph Le Botte in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
